ArticleTitle.sentence: Regulation of M-CSF expression by M-CSF: role of protein kinase C and transcription factor NF kappa B.

event.clue: Regulation of M-CSF expression by M-CSF: role of protein kinase C and transcription factor NF kappa B.

AbstractText.sentence: Macrophage-colony-stimulating factor (M-CSF), also referred to as CSF-1, regulates the survival, growth, differentiation and functional activity of monocytes by binding to a single class of high-affinity cell surface receptors, known to be the product of the c-fms protooncogene.

AbstractText.sentence: The detection of both M-CSF and c-fms expression by cells of the monocyte lineage has suggested that M-CSF may act by an autocrine mechanism.

AbstractText.sentence: Interestingly, it has been shown that M-CSF can induce the expression of its own gene.

AbstractText.sentence: Although sensitivity to M-CSF can be modulated by regulation of receptor expression and function, M-CSF responsiveness is largely determined at a postreceptor level.

AbstractText.sentence: To date, little is known about the intracellular pathway of M-CSF signal transduction.
We have therefore investigated the changes in protein kinase C (PKC) activity upon exposure of monocytes to M-CSF.
We show that M-CSF activates and translocates PKC.

event.clue: We show that M-CSF activates and translocates PKC.
We show that M-CSF activates and translocates PKC.
We show that M-CSF activates and translocates PKC.

AbstractText.sentence: Inhibition of PKC by the isoquinoline derivative H7 abolishes induction of M-CSF by M-CSF.

event.clue: Inhibition of PKC by the isoquinoline derivative H7 abolishes induction of M-CSF by M-CSF.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, activation of PKC was pertussis-toxin-sensitive and was associated with the detection of an NF kappa B protein in nuclear extracts of M-CSF-induced blood monocytes but not in monocytes exposed to medium treatment only.

AbstractText.sentence: The results suggest that M-CSF induction of M-CSF involves G proteins, PKC and NF kappa B.
